lead_paragraph: A tornado-prone city toughened its building code, becoming a model.
snippet: A tornado-prone city toughened its building code, becoming a model.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Kevin M Simmons commends city of Moore, Okla, for adopting strict building code for residential construction; says step has made town far more resilient to tornadoes that have plagued region throughout its history; cites research showing by applying this Moore code statewide, expected damage over next 25 years would be reduced by 30 percent, or $11 billion, and increase in cost would be only $3.3 billion.
